intro: Baeothryon pumilum, commonly known as the dwarf baneberry, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Berberidaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pale green flowers that appear in late spring. The plant produces red, berry-like fruits that are toxic to humans and animals. It typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has rhizomatous growth habits. Baeothryon pumilum is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in forest understories.
